Method Detail

writeElmt

public static <A extends java.lang.Appendable> A writeElmt(A out,
                                                           java.lang.String tag,
                                                           java.lang.CharSequence txt,
                                                           java.lang.Object[]... atr)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Writes an element, its attributes and text content to an Appendable.

The element name must be an alpha-numeric character sequence (see isValidElmtName(CharSequence)).

The text content entities are escaped (see writeText(Appendable, CharSequence)).

The attribute arrays must each have an even length, and contain { name, value } pairs, where each name (an even-index element) is a CharSequence, and each value is obtained by calling the Object.toString() method on the value object (the following odd-index element). Attributes whose value object is null are ignored, and only the attribute name is written for values that resolve to an empty String. The character entities in each String value are escaped.

Parameters:
out - the output Appendable
tag - the element name
txt - the text content
atr - the attributes arrays
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the output Appendable generated an exception
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element name or an attribute name is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the element name is not a valid element (see isValidElmtName(CharSequence)), the attribute arrays are not in the expected { name, value } pair format, an attribute name is not a CharSequence, or is not a valid attribute (see isValidAttrName(CharSequence))

writeElmtOpen

public static <A extends java.lang.Appendable> A writeElmtOpen(A out,
                                                               java.lang.String tag,
                                                               java.lang.Object[]... atr)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                                           java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Writes an element's opening tag and attributes to an Appendable.

The element name must be an alpha-numeric character sequence (see isValidElmtName(CharSequence)).

The attribute arrays must each have an even length, and contain { name, value } pairs, where each name (an even-index element) is a CharSequence, and each value is obtained by calling the Object.toString() method on the value object (the following odd-index element). Attributes whose value object is null are ignored, and only the attribute name is written for values that resolve to an empty String. The character entities in each String value are escaped (see writeText(Appendable, CharSequence)).

Type Parameters:
A - the Appendable type
Parameters:
out - the output Appendable
tag - the element name
atr - the attributes arrays
Returns:
the output Appendable (to facilitate chaining)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the output Appendable generated an exception
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element name or an attribute name is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the element name is not a valid element (see isValidElmtName(CharSequence)), the attribute arrays are not in the expected { name, value } pair format, an attribute name is not a CharSequence, or is not a valid attribute (see isValidAttrName(CharSequence))

The element name must be an alpha-numeric character sequence (see isValidElmtName(CharSequence)).

the output Appendable (to facilitate chaining)

java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element name is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the element name is not a valid element (see isValidElmtName(CharSequence))

writeAttr

public static <A extends java.lang.Appendable> A writeAttr(A out,
                                                           java.lang.Object[]... atr)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Writes the attributes of an element to an Appendable.

The attribute arrays must each have an even length, and contain { name, value } pairs, where each name (an even-index element) is a CharSequence, and each value is obtained by calling the Object.toString() method on the value object (the following odd-index element). Attributes whose value object is null are ignored, and only the attribute name is written for values that resolve to an empty String. The character entities in each String value are escaped (see writeText(Appendable, CharSequence)).

Type Parameters:
A - the Appendable type
Parameters:
out - the output Appendable
atr - the attribute arrays
Returns:
the output Appendable (to facilitate chaining)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the output Appendable generated an exception
java.lang.NullPointerException - if an attribute name is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the attribute arrays are not in the expected { name, value } pair format, an attribute name is not a CharSequence, or is not a valid attribute (see isValidAttrName(CharSequence))

writeText

public static <A extends java.lang.Appendable> A writeText(A out,
                                                           java.lang.CharSequence txt)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
Writes text to an Appendable, escaping character entities.

The character entities '&', '<', '>', '"' are replaced, respectively, by the strings "&amp;","&lt;", "&gt;", "&quot;"

Type Parameters:
A - the Appendable type
Parameters:
out - the output Appendable
txt - the text to escape
Returns:
the output Appendable (to facilitate chaining)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the output Appendable generated an exception

isValidAttrName

public static boolean isValidAttrName(java.lang.CharSequence name)
Checks whether a CharSequence is a valid XML attribute name.

A valid name is a sequence of the characters [-+._A-Za-z].

Parameters:
name - the name to check
Returns:
true if the name is valid

isValidAttrChar

public static boolean isValidAttrChar(int c)
Checks whether a character is legal in a XML attribute name.

A legal character is in [-+._A-Za-z].

Parameters:
c - the character to check
Returns:
true if the character is legal
